questions.statement: What is the numerical range of a char data type in Java?
questions.explain: Char occupies 16-bit in memory, so it supports 2^16 i:e from 0 to 65535.

questions.statement: Which of these coding types is used for data type characters in Java?
questions.explain: Unicode defines fully international character set that can represent all the characters found in all human languages. Its range is from 0 to 65536.

questions.statement: Which of these values can a boolean variable contain?
questions.explain: Boolean variable can contain only one of two possible values, true and false.

questions.statement: Which of these occupy first 0 to 127 in Unicode character set used for characters in Java?
questions.explain: First 0 to 127 character set in Unicode are same as those of ISO-LATIN-1 and ASCII.

questions.statement: Which one is a valid declaration of a boolean?
questions.explain: Boolean can only be assigned true or false literals.
